meanings.definition: A person or thing that lags behind.
meanings.sent1: The lagger in the race struggled to keep up with the others.
meanings.sent2: The lagger always arrived last to the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The lagger in the group made everyone laugh with their slow pace.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a lagger in the fast-paced city, always a step behind.
meanings.sent5: The little turtle was a lagger compared to the speedy rabbit.

meanings.definition: A person who delays or lingers.
meanings.sent1: The lagger at the bus stop made everyone wait longer.
meanings.sent2: The lagger in the line took their time deciding what to order.
meanings.sent3: The lagger at the party was the last to leave, enjoying every moment.
meanings.sent4: She was a lagger in making decisions, always needing more time.
meanings.sent5: The lagger in the group chat replied hours after everyone else.

meanings.definition: A piece of wood used to separate or support objects.
meanings.sent1: He used a lagger to prop up the wobbly table leg.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter grabbed a lagger to keep the shelves in place.
meanings.sent3: The lagger served as a makeshift doorstop in the old house.
meanings.sent4: She used a lagger to create a barrier between the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The lagger prevented the books from falling off the shelf.
